Constructor Detail

Level

public Level(File input)
Creates a level from file. Presumable a Level has been created using the drawPanel and saved to a .txt file of a chosen name. Refer to DrawPanel.save(String fileName) for more info.

Parameters:
input - This is the .txt file which contains the key information about a Level.

Level

public Level(Polynomial a,
             Polynomial b)
This constructor basically just adds the two polynomials to peices, and sets the bounds so that both are shown.

Method Detail

add

public void add(Polynomial p)
Parameters:
p - appends p onto the last index of peices.

add

public void add(Polynomial p,
                IntersectCircle intersect)
Parameters:
p - appends p onto the last index of peices.

find

public Polynomial find(int inputX,
                       int globalX)
Parameters:
inputX - This is a real X coordinate from the screen, without regard to any shifting variables.
globalX - The global Shift variable being applied to the level. This method takes an input and the shift value, and returns the polynomial that is within the bounds. This has been tested and works perfectly.

get

public Polynomial get(int index)
Returns:
Returns the Polynomial at index.

getLast

public Polynomial getLast()
Returns:
Returns the Polynomial at the last index.

globalDraw

public void globalDraw(Graphics g,
                       int globalX,
                       int globalY)
Draws a Level object with respect to a global shift variable.

Parameters:
g - This is the Graphics Object that is being used to draw. By accepting a Graphics Object as a parameter it allows the drawing to be done within each individual class, rather than have a superfluous amount of code in the driver(s).
globalX - An external variable that is used to shift the graph, potentially used in relation to a moving point of reference.
globalY - Shifts the graph vertically by this value.

indexOf

public int indexOf(int inputX,
                   int globalX)

indexOf

public int indexOf(Polynomial p)

length

public int length()
Returns:
returns the total number of Polynomials in this Level.

refreshBounds

public void refreshBounds(int globalX,
                          int width)
This method changes the bounds of the Polynomial so only polynomials that are within the bounds of the screen are displayed. Without this relatively simple method Level(s) with a large number of peices would start to lag/destroy your computer by overworking it unnecessarily. It works by checking if there are any Polynomials that should be on the screen that aren't, and by checking to see if any polynomials that aren't on the screen are being graphed. Note that leftIndex and rightIndex are the indices of the Polynomial[] at the left and right bounds.

Parameters:
globalX - In this case globalX refers to the left bound of the screen.
width - globalX+width refers to the right bounds of the screen.

scrambleColors

public void scrambleColors()

setColor

public void setColor(Color color)
Parameters:
color - Changes the color of this level to this color.
